Kendi kendime gelecek sayÄ±da neler olabilir acaba diye dÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼nÃ¼r, hayali editoryal yazÄ±lar hazÄ±rlar, hatta oyun tanÄ±tÄ±mlarÄ± bile yapardÄ±m.

Sonra 64’ler dergisi Ã§Ä±ktÄ±. Commodore Dergisine gÃ¶re daha basitti, sadece oyunlar Ã¼zerine eÄŸilmiÅŸti. BÃ¶yle bir dergide Ã§alÄ±ÅŸmak ne kadar keyifli olur diye dÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼nmÃ¼ÅŸtÃ¼m. Bilgisayar dergilerinin hep bir ayrÄ± yeri olmuÅŸtur hayatÄ±mda. Mesele ACE (Advanced Computer Entertainment)â€˜i gÃ¶rÃ¼nce, sayfa dÃ¼zeniyle, kutucuklu yorumlarÄ±yla kim hayran kalmamÄ±ÅŸtÄ±r. EditÃ¶rlÃ¼kden daha Ã¶nemli olan ÅŸeyin, aslÄ±nda okuyucuya hitap eden ÅŸeyin gÃ¶rsel yÃ¶netmenlik olduÄŸunu farketmiÅŸimdir ACE’i gÃ¶rdÃ¼kten sonra. Bizim dergilerde Ã¶zenirdi onlara ama bir tÃ¼rlÃ¼ becerememiÅŸlerdir, o ayrÄ±. (64’ler bir ara baya ilerleme kaydetmiÅŸti, hakkÄ±nÄ± vermek lazÄ±m)

Daha sonra underground fanzin’ler Ã§Ä±ktÄ±. Siyah-beyaz ve fotokopi ile Ã§oÄŸaltÄ±lÄ±rlardÄ±. Underground olmak, Ã§ok bilinmemek, para kazanmak iÃ§in deÄŸil keyif alÄ±ndÄ±ÄŸÄ± iÃ§in yapÄ±lan iÅŸlerin temel dÃ¼sturu olmakla birlikte bir noktadan sonra Ã§ok iyi reklam aracÄ± olmuÅŸtu. Speed-Thrash’den daha hafif mÃ¼zikler kesinlikle olmayacak dendiÄŸi halde kÄ±sa sÃ¼rede rock dergisine dÃ¶nÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼vermiÅŸti.

Severdim Laneth’i, hele Murat AdanÃ§’da yazmaya baÅŸlayÄ±nca. Bilgisayar dergiciliÄŸi sonrasÄ±nda ufak tefek birÅŸeyler yazdÄ±ÄŸÄ±m konular arasÄ±nda pek bilinmeyen mÃ¼zik gruplarÄ±nÄ± tanÄ±tma amaÃ§lÄ± yazdÄ±ÄŸÄ±m yazÄ±lar olmuÅŸtur o dÃ¶nemlerde. (tabi hiÃ§biri yayÄ±nlanmadÄ±, o ayrÄ± mesele)

Åimdi neden oturdum da bunlarÄ± yazma gereÄŸi hissettim diye sorabilir herkes. Socrates Dergisi yÃ¼zÃ¼nden. Nisan ayÄ±nda elime aldÄ±ÄŸÄ±m ilk sayÄ±sÄ±nda, Commodore Dergisi’ni, 64’ler Dergisi’ni, Amiga DÃ¼nyasÄ± Dergisi’ni, Laneth Dergisi’ni, ACE’i, PC Format’Ä± ilk kez elime aldÄ±ÄŸÄ±mda hissettiÄŸim ÅŸeyleri hissettiÄŸim iÃ§in yazdÄ±m. Yani dergiyi okuyup bitirdikten sonra gÃ¶rsel tasarÄ±mÄ± sayesinde sadece sayfalarÄ±na gÃ¶z gezdirmek iÃ§in bile tekrar elime alabiliyorsam o dergi okunup atÄ±lmak iÃ§in deÄŸil, kÃ¼tÃ¼phanede biryerlerde saklanmak iÃ§indir. Takip ettiÄŸim sayÄ±sÄ±z dergi olmuÅŸtur ÅŸimdiye kadar ama sadece yukarÄ±da saydÄ±klarÄ±mÄ± saklamÄ±ÅŸÄ±m biryerlerde, diÄŸerleri yok olup gitmiÅŸ. Socrates’de yÄ±llar sonra ilk kez saklayacaÄŸÄ±m dergiler arasÄ±nda yerini aldÄ±.

OynadÄ±ÄŸÄ±mÄ±z oyunlar dijital, ne kutusu ne basÄ±lÄ± kullanÄ±m kÄ±lavuzu var artÄ±k, mÃ¼zik albÃ¼mÃ¼ satÄ±n almÄ±yoruz, dinlediÄŸimiz ÅŸarkÄ±lar dijital, dinliyoruz ve unutuyoruz, kitaplar e-book oluyor yavaÅŸ yavaÅŸâ€¦SaklayabileceÄŸim birÅŸeyler bulduÄŸumda seviniyorum artÄ±kâ€¦

YaÅŸÄ± 40’a yaklaÅŸmÄ±ÅŸ bir kiÅŸinin reflekslerinin zayÄ±flamasÄ±, hÄ±zlÄ± karar vererek dÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼ndÃ¼ÄŸÃ¼nÃ¼z ÅŸeyi koordine edebilme, kombinasyonu saÄŸlama reaksiyon sÃ¼resi yaÅŸ ilerledikÃ§e oldukÃ§a yavaÅŸlÄ±yor.

item.title: True Detective
item.description: rust: look. i consider myself a realist, all right, but in philosophical terms, i’m what’s called a pessimist. martin:Â um, okay. what’s that mean? rust:Â means i’m bad at parties. martin:Â heh. let me tell you. you ain’t great outside of parties either. rust:Â i think human consciousness was a tragic misstep in evolution. we became too self-aware. nature created an aspect of nature separate from itself. we are creatures that should not exist by natural law. martin:Â huh. that sounds god-fucking-awful, rust. rust:Â we are things that labor under the illusion of having a self, this accretion of sensory experience and feeling, programmed with total assurance that we are each somebody when, in fact, everybody’s nobody. martin:Â i wouldn’t go around spouting that shit, i was you. people around here don’t think that way. i don’t think that way. rust:Â i think the honorable thing for species to do is deny our programming, stop reproducing, walk hand in hand into extinction, one last midnight, brothers and sisters opting out of a raw deal. martin:Â so what’s the point of getting out bed in the morning? rust:Â i tell myself i bear witness, but the real answer is that it’s obviously my programming, and i lack the constitution for suicide.

In reality, itâ€™s exactly backwards: proficient users can deal with a crappy computer, but casual users need as good a computer as possible.

item.title: Scott Forstall
item.description:
Starting in 2000 with Mac OS X, Appleâ€™s desktop operating system has been Unix-based. Why is this significant? Many developers were already familiar with the Unix operating system. With a Unix base, coders could use standard Unix commands in the command line, there was greater code portability, and Mac OS X got all of the associated benefits of Unix. For example, Unix is architected in a modular fashion, which can be beneficial when it comes to system security.

Scott Forstallâ€™s departure (Why Apple (and You) Might Miss Scott Forstall)

Thereâ€™re lots of things to be happy about in this chilly December, but right now weâ€™re celebrating a milestone. Weâ€™ve surpassed the five hundred thousand (500.000) thermometer served! Rounding a half a million downloads seemed like the perfect time to launch another update that would make Thermo even more accessible to people around the world. Thermo 1.3 is now live in the App Store, and with it weâ€™re introducing 17 New languages. Weâ€™re also introducing Horizontal History (For awesome History owners), iOS Twitter integration and a redesigned auto location system.

item.description:
GeÃ§miÅŸe Ã¶zlem duyanlar, geÃ§miÅŸe dÃ¶nebilmenin yollarÄ±nÄ± ararlar. 1992 yÄ±lÄ±nda ilk PC bilgisayarÄ±ma geÃ§tiÄŸimde Commodore 64 ve Amiga benim iÃ§in tarihin tozlu sayfalarÄ±na gÃ¶mÃ¼lmÃ¼ÅŸtÃ¼. Ã–ncelikle Ã§oÄŸu oyun PC’de olmasÄ±na karÅŸÄ±n kimi oyunlarÄ±n Amiga versionlarÄ± Ã§ok daha iyiydi. Oyunlar eÄŸer 256 renk VGA Ã§Ã¶zÃ¼nÃ¼rlÃ¼ÄŸÃ¼ kullanmÄ±yorsa 16 renge mahkumdu, Amiga ise 32 renk sunuyordu. EÄŸer PC’de ses kartÄ± yoksa (ki o zamanlar ses kartÄ±m yoktu) PC hoparlÃ¶rÃ¼nden gelen bip sesleriyle yetinmek zorundaydÄ±k. PC’lerde hÄ±z konusunda bir standart yoktu, eski oyunlar oynanÄ±lmayacak kadar hÄ±zlÄ± Ã§alÄ±ÅŸÄ±yordu, Amiga oyunlarÄ± ise o donanÄ±m iÃ§in test edilmiÅŸ olarak Ã§Ä±ktÄ±ÄŸÄ±ndan yavaÅŸ olsa da en azÄ±ndan bir standarta sahipti.

Bu nedenlerle Ã§oÄŸu oyunun Amiga versionlarÄ±nÄ± hatta bazÄ± eski oyunlarÄ±n Commodore 64 versionlarÄ±nÄ± yeniden oynamak Ã§ok daha keyifli oluyordu. Bununla birlikte PC masamÄ±n Ã¼stÃ¼nÃ¼ tamamen kapladÄ±ÄŸÄ±ndan diÄŸer bilgisayarlar zamanla dolaplarÄ±ndaki yerini aldÄ±, o bilgisayarlarda oynadÄ±ÄŸÄ±m oyunlar gÃ¼zel birer hatÄ±ra oldu.

AynÄ± durumun PC’ler iÃ§in yaÅŸanacaÄŸÄ± o zamanlar hayal edilememiÅŸti tabi. DOS iÃ§in yazÄ±lmÄ±ÅŸ oyunlar 1995’den itibaren yavaÅŸ yavaÅŸ yerini Windows iÃ§in yazÄ±lmÄ±ÅŸ oyunlara bÄ±raktÄ±. Bilgisayarlar hÄ±zlandÄ±, floppy disklerin yerini CD-ROM’lar aldÄ±. DOS iÃ§in programlanan oyunlarÄ± Windows uyumluluk modunda zorlukla oynayabiliyor olsakda uyumsuzluk problemleri gecikmedi.

Bu sorunlarÄ± ortadan DOSBox isimli program kaldÄ±rdÄ±. DOSBox hemen hemen her iÅŸletim sistemi altÄ±nda Ã§alÄ±ÅŸan, tÃ¼m eski ses kartlarÄ±nÄ± destekleyen bir DOS penceresi aÃ§tÄ± bizim gibi nostaljik kiÅŸiliklierin dÃ¼nyasÄ±na. DOSBox’Ä± kullanmak Ã§ok kolay deÄŸildi tabi, sanal bir disk ortamÄ± yaratmak, ses kartÄ± adresi ve IRQ seÃ§mek iÃ§in konfigÃ¼rasyon dosyasÄ± ile uÄŸraÅŸmak gerekiyordu. Bu iÅŸlemleri kolaylaÅŸtÄ±rmak iÃ§in frontendler yazÄ±ldÄ±. BunlarÄ±n iÃ§inde bence en iyisi ve kolay kullanÄ±mlÄ± olanÄ± Boxer.

item.title: Bjarne Stroustrup
item.description:
Know your fundamentals (algorithms, data structures, machine architecture, systems) and know several programming languages to the point where you can use them idiomatically. Know some non-computer field of study well â€” math, biology, history, optics, whatever. Learn to communicate effectively in speech and in writing. Spend an unreasonable amount of time on some difficult topic to really master it. Try to do something that might make a difference in the world.

Bjarne Stroustrup, Creator & Developer of C++

item.title: Game Center & Achievements for Apps!
item.description:
Game Center should allow non-game iOS apps to register for achievements and leaderboards. Think about it: Largest Dropbox File, Most TextExpander Time Saved, Longest iStat Uptime, Most LoseIt Pounds Lost This Week.

David Chartier nails a great idea. Iâ€™d love to make Game Center-shareable achievements in Instapaper, but I donâ€™t think thereâ€™s any chance that Apple would approve it, even after todayâ€™s improvements. (via marco)

item.title: A week with Google Chrome
item.description:
nikf:

In the five years that Iâ€™ve used a Mac, Iâ€™ve had two browsers of choice: Camino, and then with Safari 3â€™s arrival Safari. I know that folks swear by Firefox, but I donâ€™t - and typically find myself swearing at Firefox. Whilst the Mozilla folks have done a fine job of making it look like a Mac app, it never seems for feel and behave like a Mac application. Part of my Safari preference is that I also have a teeny bit of a crush for WebKit, the engine that powers Safari with its CSS animations and long-supported (much clichÃ©d) rounded corners.

In a quick trawl through my Applications folder last weekend, I happened to come across a rather old Chrome OS X Developer Preview that Iâ€™d downloaded and promptly forgotten about. Purely out of curiosity I ran it, made sure it was up to date, and started using it.

I havenâ€™t stopped since.

Some Observations

  1. Itâ€™s fast. Lightning fast - I thought Safari was snappy (and compared to Firefox and Camino, it is) but Chrome is screaming in comparison.
  2. Top tabs - I was probably in the minority to mourn their demise in the final Safari 4 release, but itâ€™s great to have them back. The behaviour of Chromeâ€™s â€œOpen in New Tabâ€ option is also fantastic: when opening links in a new tab, the tab opens alongside the existing tab youâ€™re working in. Safari adds tabs after the right-most tab, whereas Chromeâ€™s option groups the links together, easily allowing you to return to your original tab.
  3. Itâ€™s super-stable - itâ€™s not crashed or hung on me in a week - and itâ€™s still not entered Beta. Take that, Safari.
  4. The combined search / address field - I find myself still hitting Tab, expecting it to focus a search box, but another few days use should cure that.
  5. Itâ€™s WebKit - enough said.

The bit where I whinge about some minor issue

Whilst Chrome looks and feels like a Mac application, thereâ€™s one striking annoyance that irritates me: the behaviour when you click on a Folder in the Bookmark bar. In any other browser, it behaves as an OS X menu should. That is, no matter where you click the item, the menu should appear in a fixed location, below the menu item in question. OS Xâ€™s default contextual menus appear directly below and to the right of the area you click.

As it stands right now - and shown in the above comparison - Chromeâ€™s bookmark folders behave like a contextual menu (despite also having their own contextual menus), and itâ€™s driving me a little crazy. Yes, Chrome remains in Pre-Beta - and these things can change - but itâ€™s details like this that make or break whether an application feels like a Mac application. Never mind if an appâ€™s got aqua buttons, a sexy HUD or any other aesthetic beauty. Itâ€™s all about how an application behaves.

If youâ€™re wanting to give Chrome a go, itâ€™s available from the Chrome Developer Channel. Itâ€™s still pre-beta, however in my experience it seems to be more relating to its feature-incomplete state than anything else. Iâ€™ve been using the Chrome Preview non-stop for the past week, and youâ€™ll have to pry it out of my cold, dead hands.
